reference.shortdesc: A syntax phrase is a small group of pieces of syntax.

section.title: Usage information
section.p: The synph element is used when a complete syntax diagram is not needed, but some of the syntax elements, such as kwd, oper, or delim are used within the text flow of the topic content.

section.title: Specialization hierarchy
section.p: The synph element is specialized from ph. It is defined in the syntax-diagram domain module, which is a specialization of the programming domain module.

example.title: Example
example.p: The following code sample shows how the synph element can be used to identify a syntax phrase that must be run before a task:
example.codeblock: <task id="setup-volume"> <title>Setting up a new volume</title> <shortdesc>This task will help you set up a new volume for your account.</shortdesc> <taskbody> <prereq>Before starting this procedure, ensure that you have requested the volume using the <synph><kwd>request</kwd> <var>volumename</var></synph> command.</prereq> <!-- ... --> </taskbody> </task>
